title: What to See in Zanzibar: Must-Visit Spots
excerpt: Discover Zanzibar's most incredible attractions, from the historic Stone Town to pristine beaches and unique wildlife experiences.

content.title: Introduction
content.content: Planning a Zanzibar holiday? From the historic streets of Stone Town to pristine beaches and unique wildlife experiences, here are the must-visit spots that should be on every traveler's itinerary.

items.title: Stone Town Zanzibar üèõÔ∏è
items.content: Explore the historic heart of Zanzibar, a UNESCO World Heritage site. Wander through narrow alleys filled with ornate wooden doors, vibrant spice markets, and historic buildings like the House of Wonders. Don't miss the evening food market at Forodhani Gardens for authentic local flavors.

items.title: Prison Island Zanzibar üê¢
items.content: Just a short boat ride from Stone Town, Prison Island (Changuu) is home to a colony of giant Aldabra tortoises. Originally intended as a prison in the 1800s, the island now serves as a tourist attraction where you can feed and photograph these magnificent creatures, some over 100 years old.

items.title: Nungwi & Kendwa Beaches üå¥
items.content: Located on the northern tip of Zanzibar, these beaches offer some of the most spectacular sunset views on the island. The white sand and turquoise waters make them perfect for swimming and sunbathing, while the minimal tide variation means you can swim all day.

items.title: Mnemba Island üê†
items.content: A pristine coral atoll offering world-class diving and snorkeling experiences. The surrounding coral reef is home to a diverse marine life including dolphins, sea turtles, and countless tropical fish species. Perfect for both beginner and experienced divers.

items.title: Jozani Forest üåø
items.content: The only national park in Zanzibar and home to the endemic Zanzibar red colobus monkey. This beautiful forest also features mangrove boardwalks, nature trails, and various other wildlife species. A must-visit for nature enthusiasts and wildlife photographers.

items.title: The Rock Restaurant Zanzibar üçΩÔ∏è
items.content: Perched on a rock in the Indian Ocean, this unique restaurant offers an unforgettable dining experience. At high tide, it's completely surrounded by water and accessible only by boat. Enjoy fresh seafood while taking in panoramic ocean views.

items.title: Best Time to Visit
items.content: Most attractions are accessible year-round, but the dry seasons (June-October and December-February) offer the best conditions for sightseeing.

items.title: Getting Around
items.content: Many attractions can be visited as part of organized tours, or you can hire a private driver for more flexibility. Some locations like Stone Town are best explored on foot.

items.title: Photography Tips
items.content: Early morning or late afternoon offer the best lighting for photography, especially in Stone Town and at the beaches.

content.title: Final Thoughts
content.content: There's no shortage of amazing places to see in Zanzibar! Each attraction offers its own unique experience, from historical exploration to natural wonders. Use Zafiri to book tours, hotels, and flights to Zanzibar easily and make the most of your island adventure.
